nav.div: Farmington Municipal Schools » COVID-19 Updates and Info » Student meals during closure

p.span: School meals will be available to students via morning and evening pick up locations for centrally located students and schools and via daily bus drop off for students in more remote and distant areas of our district.

MORNING CURBSIDE PICK UP will be held every Monday through Friday until May 28, 2020 from 11am – 1pm. (No meal service on 5/25/2020 – Memorial Day) Every child participant at these locations below will receive a hot lunch meal and a cold breakfast meal for the next day. Pick up locations are:

Animas Elementary
Apache Elementary
Bluffview Elementary
Farmington High
Hermosa Middle
McCormick Elementary
McKinley Elementary
Mesa Verde Elementary
At Bluffview Elementary and Farmington High School locations curbside pick-up has been moved closer to the kitchen areas please look for the neon signs for curbside directions.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: is available for meals from 3:30pm – 5:30pm at Farmington Boys & Girls Club (1925 Positive Way) and from 5pm -7pm at Central Kitchen (305 N. Court Ave) All children/students ages 1-18 are eligible for meals at any site, not just at the school they attend. Children must be present to pick up meals. Breakfast and lunch will be served at the same time, if meals will not be eaten immediately please hold in a refrigerator promptly. All meals must be taken home, meals cannot be eaten on the school premises. Parents/Guardians should use designated loading zones for car or walking pick-ups.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: WEEKEND MEAL SERVICE ON FRIDAYS starts on 4/17/2020

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: – At the Central Kitchen PM curbside service site

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: meals for Saturday and Sunday will be available for pick up during the regular 5pm – 7pm meal service. Students will receive two breakfast and two lunch meals for the weekend.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 20px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: MEAL DROP OFFS will be delivered via bus Monday-Friday, until May 28, 2020. The list of areas and bus numbers are listed below.

span.div: DURING MEAL DROP OFFS PLEASE PRACTICE RESPONSIBLE SOCIAL DISTANCING PRACTICES, MAINTAIN A SAFE (ABOUT 6 FEET) DISTANCE BETWEEN OTHER FAMILIES, AVOID HANDSHAKES, HUGS AND OTHER CONTACT, AND RETURN TO YOUR HOME AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

p.span: Meals will be dropped Monday through Friday at designated elementary morning bus stop with a 2-hour delay. Buses will be only stopping at the listed, designated elementary stops. All children/students ages 1 -18 are eligible for meals at any stop. Children must be present to pick up meals. Breakfast and lunch will be served at the same time. All meals must be taken home. If meals will not be eaten immediately please hold in a refrigerator promptly.

SPECIAL DIET MEAL ACCOMMODATIONS ARE NOT AVAILABLE Based on the sheer volume and emergency status of the meals we are serving it is impossible to ensure that all required safety protocols could be properly enforced to ensure a special diet meal wouldn't come into contact with a known allergen. The risk of cross contamination is too great and any error made could cause great harm up to even death to a child.
Questions about drop off times/locations? Call 505.599.8623

a.span: See Something, Say Something: Report Online

div.p: Farmington Municipal Schools does not discriminate nor tolerate harassment on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, genetic information or pregnancy in its educational programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices; and it will take immediate action to eliminate such harassment, prevent its recurrence, and address its effects.
Anyone experiencing any form of discrimination or harassment should contact the Executive Director of Human Resources (505-324-9840) to report the incident.
